p: As of on March 16, 2020, there were 81,077 confirmed infections and 3218 deaths in China, and 86,434 confirmed cases with 3388 deaths were reported in 151 countries (Italy, Iran, South Korea, Spain, Germany, were the top five countries) [ 10]. Therefore, early diagnosis, treatment, and intervention are particularly important. Although viral nucleic acid detection using real-time polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) remains the diagnostic criteria, the sensitivity of an initial chest CT was greater than the first RT-PCR [ 11, 12]. Chest CT can screen patients infected with COVID-19. However, it is worth considering how to evaluate the value and effective use of chest CT in COVID-19. We share three cases of COVID-19 to evaluate the value of chest CT in the epidemic area.
